trans-unit.source: The Packages page is where you upload all of the package files (.xap, .appx, .appxupload, and/or .appxbundle) for the app that you're submitting.
trans-unit.target: The Packages page is where you upload all of the package files (.xap, .appx, .appxupload, and/or .appxbundle) for the app that you're submitting.

trans-unit.source: You can upload packages for any operating system that your app targets in this step.
trans-unit.target: You can upload packages for any operating system that your app targets in this step.

trans-unit.source: Upload app packages
trans-unit.target: Upload app packages

trans-unit.source: Upload app packages
trans-unit.target: Upload app packages

trans-unit.source: The **Packages** page is where you upload all of the package files (.xap, .appx, .appxupload, and/or .appxbundle) for the app that you're submitting.
trans-unit.target: The **Packages** page is where you upload all of the package files (.xap, .appx, .appxupload, and/or .appxbundle) for the app that you're submitting.

trans-unit.source: You can upload packages for any operating system that your app targets in this step.
trans-unit.target: You can upload packages for any operating system that your app targets in this step.

trans-unit.source: When a customer downloads your app, the Store will look through all of your app's available packages and will automatically provide each customer with the package that works best for their device.
trans-unit.target: When a customer downloads your app, the Store will look through all of your app's available packages and will automatically provide each customer with the package that works best for their device.

trans-unit.source: For details about what a package includes and how it must be structured, see [App package requirements](app-package-requirements.md).
trans-unit.target: For details about what a package includes and how it must be structured, see [App package requirements](app-package-requirements.md).

trans-unit.source: You'll also want to learn about [how version numbers may impact which packages are delivered to specific customers](package-version-numbering.md), and [how packages are distributed to different operating systems](guidance-for-app-package-management.md).
trans-unit.target: You'll also want to learn about [how version numbers may impact which packages are delivered to specific customers](package-version-numbering.md), and [how packages are distributed to different operating systems](guidance-for-app-package-management.md).

trans-unit.source: Uploading packages to your submission
trans-unit.target: Uploading packages to your submission

trans-unit.source: To upload packages, drag them into the upload field or click to browse your files.
trans-unit.target: To upload packages, drag them into the upload field or click to browse your files.

trans-unit.source: The **Packages** page will let you upload .xap, .appx, .appxupload, and/or .appxbundle files.
trans-unit.target: The **Packages** page will let you upload .xap, .appx, .appxupload, and/or .appxbundle files.

trans-unit.source: **Note** For Windows 10, you should always upload the .appxupload file here, not the .appx or .appxbundle.
trans-unit.target: **Note** For Windows 10, you should always upload the .appxupload file here, not the .appx or .appxbundle.

trans-unit.source: For more info about packaging UWP apps for the Store, see [Packaging Universal Windows apps for Windows 10](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=620193 ).
trans-unit.target: For more info about packaging UWP apps for the Store, see [Packaging Universal Windows apps for Windows 10](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=620193 ).

trans-unit.source: If we detect issues with your packages while validating them, you'll need to remove the package, fix the issue, and then try uploading it again.
trans-unit.target: If we detect issues with your packages while validating them, you'll need to remove the package, fix the issue, and then try uploading it again.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [Resolve package upload errors](resolve-package-upload-errors.md).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [Resolve package upload errors](resolve-package-upload-errors.md).

trans-unit.source: You may also see warnings to let you know about issues that may cause problems but won't block you from continuing with your submission.
trans-unit.target: You may also see warnings to let you know about issues that may cause problems but won't block you from continuing with your submission.

trans-unit.source: Package details
trans-unit.target: Package details

trans-unit.source: After your packages have been successfully uploaded, we'll list them, grouped by target operating system.
trans-unit.target: After your packages have been successfully uploaded, we'll list them, grouped by target operating system.

trans-unit.source: The name, version, and architecture of the package will be displayed.
trans-unit.target: The name, version, and architecture of the package will be displayed.

trans-unit.source: For more info such as the supported languages, app capabilities, and file size for each package, click **Details**.
trans-unit.target: For more info such as the supported languages, app capabilities, and file size for each package, click **Details**.

trans-unit.source: If you are using [Windows ad mediation](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt219691), you'll also see a link to configure ad mediation for each package.
trans-unit.target: If you are using [Windows ad mediation](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt219691), you'll also see a link to configure ad mediation for each package.

trans-unit.source: If you need to remove a package from your submission, click the **Remove** link at the bottom of each package's **Details** section.
trans-unit.target: If you need to remove a package from your submission, click the **Remove** link at the bottom of each package's **Details** section.

trans-unit.source: Removing redundant packages
trans-unit.target: Removing redundant packages

trans-unit.source: If we detect that one or more of your packages is redundant, we'll display a warning suggesting that you remove the redundant packages from this submission.
trans-unit.target: If we detect that one or more of your packages is redundant, we'll display a warning suggesting that you remove the redundant packages from this submission.

trans-unit.source: Often this happens when you have previously uploaded packages, and now you are providing higher-versioned packages that support the same set of customers.
trans-unit.target: Often this happens when you have previously uploaded packages, and now you are providing higher-versioned packages that support the same set of customers.

trans-unit.source: In this case, no customers would ever get the redundant package, because you now have a better (higher-versioned) package to support these customers.
trans-unit.target: In this case, no customers would ever get the redundant package, because you now have a better (higher-versioned) package to support these customers.

trans-unit.source: When we detect that you have redundant packages, we'll provide an option to remove all of the redundant packages from this submission automatically.
trans-unit.target: When we detect that you have redundant packages, we'll provide an option to remove all of the redundant packages from this submission automatically.

trans-unit.source: You can also remove packages from the submission individually if you prefer.
trans-unit.target: You can also remove packages from the submission individually if you prefer.

trans-unit.source: Packages with Visual Studio Application Insights
trans-unit.target: Packages with Visual Studio Application Insights

trans-unit.source: We recommend that you use [Visual Studio Application Insights](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=615086) in your packages (or enable it by checking the box for “Show telemetry in the Windows Dev Center” when building your package) so that we can provide you with [app usage telemetry details](usage-report.md).
trans-unit.target: We recommend that you use [Visual Studio Application Insights](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=615086) in your packages (or enable it by checking the box for “Show telemetry in the Windows Dev Center” when building your package) so that we can provide you with [app usage telemetry details](usage-report.md).

trans-unit.source: If you didn’t configure Application Insights in Microsoft Visual Studio, when we detect that a package includes it, we'll display a message confirming that by submitting your package, you agree to enable app usage telemetry about your developer account.
trans-unit.target: If you didn’t configure Application Insights in Microsoft Visual Studio, when we detect that a package includes it, we'll display a message confirming that by submitting your package, you agree to enable app usage telemetry about your developer account.

trans-unit.source: You can disable app usage telemetry at any time in your **Account settings**.
trans-unit.target: You can disable app usage telemetry at any time in your **Account settings**.
